p: Estimated values of the Gibbs energy give the possibility to suppose that the ions of copper – ΔG = –25.6 kJ/mol, iron – ΔG = –23.7 kJ/mol, nickel – ΔG = –21.5 kJ/mol, cobalt – ΔG = –20.0 kJ/mol are fixed steadily on the zeolite surface, the sorption takes place (develops) surely. Zeolite of the Yagodnisky deposit of the Kamchatka region can be used for the sorption of heavy metals such as copper, iron, nickel and cobalt from aqueous solutions.
